definition: lit. a cup of soup/fig. to get part of the profits/one's share of the action
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup
soup
(acknowledged) place/a role to play/niche
to seize (the strategic high ground)
share/portion
to compete/competition
to play yabao (a gambling game)/(fig.) to gamble on/to take one's chance/to try one's luck
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
key moment/decisive opportunity
to march/to advance
to profiteer/to gain some underhand advantage
big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to partition/to divide up
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to set foot in/to step into/to become involved for the first time
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
